Based on the information provided, I would recommend "Hitch" and "The Taming of the Shrew". Both movies are based on classic Shakespearean plays, and both feature talented actors who bring the characters to life in a compelling way.

"Hitch" is a romantic comedy movie that follows the misadventures of a Hollywood filmmaker named Hitchcock. The movie stars Tim Robbins as Hitchcock, Uma Thurman as Marnie, Anthony Hopkins as Norman Bates, John Malkovich as Michael Mann, and Emily Watson as Emily Watson.

"Hitch" was directed by Robert Wise and written by Richard Matheson. The movie was released in 1990.

"The Taming of the Shrew" is a romantic comedy movie that follows the misadventures of two wealthy Italian families: the Brawlers and the Bravolas. The movie stars William Shakespeare as himself, Kate Winslet as Lady Macbeth, Laurence Olivier as King Lear, Christian Bale as Lionel Trunchbull, Michael Caine as Alfredo Montez, Ben Kingsley as King John, and Samantha Bond as Queen Elizabeth I.
"The Taming of the Shrew" was directed by Baz Luhrmann and written by Luhrmann and Tom Stoppard. The movie was released in 1999.

Overall, both "Hitch" and "The Taming of the Shrew" are classic romantic comedy movies that are worth watching for anyone who enjoys this genre.
